meanings.definition: Complaining persistently and in a peevish or irritating way.
meanings.sent1: The whingeing child kept complaining about the smallest things.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her whingeing attitude whenever things didn't go her way.
meanings.sent3: Despite his whingeing, his friends always found a way to cheer him up.
meanings.sent4: Her whingeing voice echoed through the room, causing everyone to roll their eyes.
meanings.sent5: The whingeing sound of the broken record player grated on everyone's nerves.

meanings.sent1: His constant whingeing about the weather became tiresome to everyone around him.
meanings.sent2: The whingeing in the office was so loud that it was hard to concentrate on work.
meanings.sent3: The whingeing at the comedy show made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The whingeing of the old car engine reminded him of his childhood road trips.
meanings.sent5: The whingeing of the wind outside matched his own internal turmoil perfectly.
